oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: A ceremony performed with the Brachycerus (African Ground Weevil) in order to preserve young babies from convulsions. In the Katkop dialect by Díä!kwãin (L V.-23. 5833-5840). The Brachycerus used to cure illness in little children. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-21. 7822–7825).
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Custom observed with Bushman children, when too young to walk
